description: For a fragrant start to the day, Akuri (Parsi Eggs) is pure perfection. Soft scrambled eggs, Indian style with a mild spiced warmth in every bite.
ingredient: [{"name": "ghee or oil", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "cumin seeds", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "curry leaves", "units": "pieces", "amount": 4}, {"name": "black pepper", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "salt", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "spring onions", "units": "pieces", "amount": 2}, {"name": "ginger", "units": "tsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "turmeric powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "chilli powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "coriander powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "cilantro", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 2}, {"name": "tomato", "units": "pieces", "amount": 1}, {"name": "eggs", "units": "pieces", "amount": 4}, {"name": "lime", "units": "pieces", "amount": 1}]
step_by_step: ["In a frying pan, over a medium heat, heat the ghee/oil until hot. Add the cumin seeds, curry leaves, pepper and salt and let them sizzle for 30 seconds.", "Add the spring onion, ginger and chilli and fry for about 1 minute.", "Add the turmeric, chilli powder and coriander powder and sizzle for 30 seconds.", "Pour in the eggs and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring to create a soft scramble. Just before it's fully set, stir in the tomato and cilantro and then remove from the heat.", "Serve immediately with chapati or crusty breads and squeeze over lime if you like."]
nutrition_info: Calories: 295 kcal, Carbohydrates: 11 g, Protein: 18 g, Fat: 21 g, Saturated Fat: 9 g, Cholesterol: 510 mg, Sodium: 784 mg, Potassium: 468 mg, Fiber: 2 g, Sugar: 4 g, Vitamin A: 1762 IU, Vitamin C: 93 mg, Calcium: 108 mg, Iron: 4 mg
notes: In Mumbai, at a restaurant called Monties, I ate the most spectacular version of Akuri (Parsi eggs) that featured ground/minced lamb. I've made these at home using this recipe, only adding about 1/2 cup ground lamb at the same stage as the onion/ginger and cooking for 4-5 minutes.
